{{Infobox building | name = 100 Pine Center | alternate_names = 100 Pine Street
Continental Insurance Building | image = File:100 Pine Center.jpg | caption = | location = 100 Pine Street
[[San Francisco]], [[California]] | coordinates = {{coord|37.7926|-122.3989|display=inline,title}} | completion_date = 1972 | architect = Hertzka and Knowles | owner = Rockpoint Group | cost = | floor_area = {{convert|402500|sqft|abbr=on}} | top_floor = | floor_count = 33 | references = {{ctbuh|12689}}{{emporis|118905}}{{skyscraperpage|1114}}{{structurae|s0021856}} | building_type = Commercial offices | roof = {{convert|145.09|m|abbr=on}} | elevator_count = | structural_engineer = | main_contractor = | pushpin_map = United States San Francisco Central | developer = | management = }} '''100 Pine Center''' is a [[Office#Grading|class-A office building]] at the northwest corner of Pine Street and Front Street in [[Financial District (San Francisco)|San Francisco's Financial District]]. The building is {{convert|145|m|abbr=on}} with 33 floors, and {{convert|402500|sqft|m2|-3|abbr=on}} of rentable office space, a 150-car garage including 30 valet parking spaces.{{cite web|url=http://www.unicoprop.com/properties/100_pine.html |publisher=Unico |title=100 Pine |accessdate=December 1, 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071020154936/http://www.unicoprop.com/properties/100_pine.html |archivedate=October 20, 2007 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.waltonst.com/Our%20Funds/Fund%20I/100%20Pine%20Street.aspx |title=100 Pine Street |publisher=Walton St. Capital |accessdate=December 1, 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080113135609/http://www.waltonst.com/Our%20Funds/Fund%20I/100%20Pine%20Street.aspx |archivedate=January 13, 2008}} Completed in 1972 as headquarters of the Continental Insurance Company, the building is among the earlier of San Francisco's modern skyscrapers. By the start of the [[dot-com bubble]] the property, then owned by Grosvenor Properties,{{cite news |author=Adam Feuerstein| work=San Francisco Business Times |date=July 11, 1997 |title=100 Pine falls to Chicago real estate kingpin |url=http://sanfrancisco.bizjournals.com/sanfrancisco/stories/1997/07/14/story7.html|accessdate=December 1, 2007}} was outdated and suffered from deferred capital maintenance. In 1997, the building was purchased by Walton Capital, which invested heavily in upgrades, re-measured the building at {{convert|36000|sqft|m2}} larger than before, then aggressively re-leased space at higher rates. After two failed transactions, Walton Capital sold the building to investors led by [[Unico Properties]] in May 2000 for US$156 million.{{cite news |accessdate=December 1, 2007 |work=Business Wire | title=Unico Acquires 100 Pine Street in San Francisco|date=November 27, 2000|url=https://www.thefreelibrary.com/Unico+Acquires+100+Pine+Street+in+San+Francisco%3b+Leading+Regional...-a067364708}}{{cite news | work=San Francisco Business Times|accessdate=December 1, 2007|date=March 3, 2000|title=Cornerstone pulls plug on deal for 100 Pine St.|author=Douglas Robson|url=http://sanfrancisco.bizjournals.com/sanfrancisco/stories/2000/03/06/newscolumn2.html}} Unico re-sold the property to the [[Alaska Permanent Fund]] based on a US$149 million price in August 2005, but retained a minority ownership share.{{cite news|accessdate=December 1, 2007 |date=August 19, 2007 |title=Alaska Permanent Fund Acquires 100 Pine for Nearly $150 Million |publisher=[[LaSalle Investment Management]] |url=http://www.lasalle.com/en-US/news/2005/100_Pine.htm |author=Brooke Filkins |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080905183306/http://www.lasalle.com/en-US/news/2005/100_Pine.htm |archivedate=September 5, 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }} The property was acquired by the Rockpoint Group in February 2017 for US$287.5 million.{{cite news |url=http://news.theregistrysf.com/rockpoint-acquires-100-pine-san-francisco-287-5mm/ |title=Rockpoint Acquires 100 Pine in San Francisco for $287.5MM |date=February 10, 2017 |first=Jon |last=Peterson |work=The Registry}} ==Tenants== The tower houses many daytime office workers. Major tenants include the [[New York Life Insurance Company]]. As of 2016, it is tied with [[45 Fremont Center]] as the twenty-sixth tallest building in San Francisco. It was certified as being operated and maintained as a green building under the US Green Building Council's Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design for Existing Buildings (LEED EB 2.0) standards in July 2008.{{cite web|title=US Green Building Council LEED Project List|url=http://www.usgbc.org/LEED/Project/CertifiedProjectList.aspx|access-date=2008-08-04|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081103030148/http://www.usgbc.org/LEED/Project/CertifiedProjectList.aspx|archive-date=2008-11-03|dead-url=yes|df=}} The [[Diplomatic missions of Ireland|Consulate-General of Ireland]] is in the building.{{cite web | title=Consulate-General of Ireland in San Francisco | url=http://www.consulateofirelandsanfrancisco.org/ | publisher= Irish Department of Foreign Affairs| year=2010 | accessdate=November 23, 2010}}. ==See also== * [[List of tallest buildings in San Francisco]] ==References== {{Reflist|35em}} {{Buildings in San Francisco|state=collapsed}} [[Category:Office buildings completed in 1972]] [[Category:Skyscraper office buildings in San Francisco]] [[Category:Financial District, San Francisco]] [[Category:Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design certified buildings]]

Agnesium is a [[neologism]] coined to describe a powerful, efficient and effective organization as an entity.<ref>Introducing Organizational Behaviour and Management By David Knights, Hugh Willmott</ref> Agnesium is a combination of [https://translate.google.ch/?oe=UTF-8&ie=UTF-8&hl=en&client=tw-ob#la/en/Agnes Agnes] (Latin for powerful, efficient and effective) and the suffix -ium <ref>[http://www.thefreedictionary.com/-ium -ium]</ref> (indicating a biological structure).
The basic principle of Agnesium is that for complex structures/organizations there are many interdependencies between the members that are not known, understood or leveraged. By recognizing, understanding and leveraging these hidden interdependencies an organization can be proactive, adaptive and exploitive.

Akram Junior |parents = |signature = |website = }} '''Akram Ojjeh''' (21 April 1918 – 28 October 1991) was a [[Syria]]n-born [[Saudi Arabia|Saudi]] businessman. Ojjeh was an intermediary in deals between Saudi Arabia and [[France]], particularly arms sales. Ojjeh founded [[Techniques d'Avant Garde]], an investment company focused on advanced technologies. ==Techniques d'Avant Garde, (TAG)== Ojjeh founded [[Techniques d'Avant Garde]], an investment company focused on advanced technologies.{{cite web|url = http://www.mclaren.com/partners/group.php|title=The McLaren Group|accessdate =17 April 2007|year=2007|work = www.mclaren.com|publisher = McLaren Group|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20070416082339/http://www.mclaren.com/partners/group.php|archivedate= 16 April 2007 | deadurl= no}} TAG Group (Holdings) S.A. generates revenue through its various subsidiaries that offer products and services in the business aviation, motorsports, hospitality, consumer products and real estate industries. TAG was formed in 1977 is currently led by Akkram's son, Chief Executive Officer [[Mansour Ojjeh]]{{Sfn|Business Week|2012}} In 1985, TAG Group (Holdings) S.A. purchased Swiss watchmaker Heuer. TAG Group combined the TAG and Heuer brands to create the [[TAG Heuer]] brand and also gave its newly acquired watchmaking subsidiary the combined TAG Heuer name. Under TAG Group's ownership, TAG Heuer modernised its product line and significantly increased worldwide sales. [[LVMH]] purchased the TAG Heuer subsidiary in 1999 for [[USD|US]]$740 million.{{Sfn|CNN Money|1999}} TAG Group is now primarily a holding company for Ojjeh shareholdings in TAG Aviation and [[McLaren Technology Group|MTG]]. ==Al-Yamamah arms deal== Ojjeh was involved in the marketing of the French [[Dassault Mirage 2000|Mirage 2000]] fighter jet to Saudi Arabia in competition with the British [[Panavia Tornado|Tornado]]. [[Adnan Khashoggi]] said in 1994 that Ojjeh was persuaded by the British sales team to "drop his role as 'fixer' for the French."{{cite news| first=Marie|last=Colvin|title= Chasing the truth with AK the arms dealer|work = Sunday Times|publisher = Times Newspapers|date=16 October 1994}} [[British Aerospace]] went on to win what became the [[Al-Yamamah arms deal]]. ==''SS France'' liner== Akram Ojjeh purchased the ocean liner ''[[SS France (1961)|SS France]]'' in October 24, 1977, for 80 million francs. On June 25, 1979, he sold it to [[Knut Kloster]], the owner of [[Norwegian Caribbean Line]], for 77 million francs. ==Personal life== Ojjeh was married four times. He was firstly married to a French woman with whom he had five children including [[Mansour Ojjeh|Mansour]] and Aziz.{{cite web|title=Mansour Ojjeh|url=http://www.grandprix.com/gpe/cref-ojjman.html|publisher=F1 News|accessdate=6 July 2012}}{{cite web|last=Padfield|first=R. Randall|title=EBACE 2011: TAG Aviation Focusing on Growth in Europe and Asia|url=http://www.ainonline.com/aviation-news/ebace-convention-news/2011-05-18/ebace-2011-tag-aviation-focusing-growth-europe-and-asia|publisher=AIN|accessdate=6 July 2012|date=19 May 2012}} He later married to Nahid Tlass (born 1958) who is daughter of former Syria Defense Minister [[Mustafa Tlass]].{{cite news|title=Defection of Syrian general 'significant': US|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5j9WkeMpOQV4iKzcOBdPo5gIfSBKg?docId=CNG.9c5b4c77a9a3ad4710ca2a4a8b25c021.b11&index=0|accessdate=6 July 2012|newspaper=AFP|date=6 July 2012}} Mohammad Hafiz | publisher = Al Madina Publishing and Printing Company | editor = | chiefeditor = [[Salman bin Yousuf Al Dossary]] | assoceditor = Abdul Rahman Al Mansour{{cite news|title=Al-Mansour appointed Al Eqtisadiah deputy editor in chief |url=http://www.allvoices.com/news/8867913-almansour-appointed-aleqtisadiah-deputy-editor-in-chief |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120724071034/http://www.allvoices.com/news/8867913-almansour-appointed-aleqtisadiah-deputy-editor-in-chief |dead-url=yes |archive-date=24 July 2012 |accessdate=22 May 2012 |newspaper=Arab News |date=22 April 2011 }} | maneditor = Eid Al Thaqil{{cite web|last=Tawalbeh|first=Khalid|title=SJA board holds first meeting after elections|url=http://www.arabnews.com/sja-board-holds-first-meeting-after-elections|date=18 May 2012|work=Arab News|accessdate=19 May 2012}} | newseditor = | managingeditordesign = | campuseditor = | campuschief = | opeditor = | sportseditor = | photoeditor = | staff = | foundation = {{start date and age|1962}} | political = | language = [[Arabic]] | ceased publication = | headquarters = [[Riyadh]]; [[Dahran]] | circulation = 60,000 (2007) | sister newspapers = ''[[Arab News]]''
''[[Asharq al Awsat]]'' {{cite news|title=Al Fayez appointed Al Eqtisadiah editor |url=http://archive.arabnews.com/?page=1§ion=0&article=29055&d=19&m=7&y=2003 |accessdate=10 May 2012 |newspaper=Arab News |date=19 July 2003 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120616061137/http://archive.arabnews.com/?page=1 |archivedate=16 June 2012 |df=dmy }} | ISSN = | oclc = 264791347 | website = [http://www.aleqt.com/ ''Al Eqtisadiah''] }} '''''Al Eqtisadiah''''' ({{lang-ar|الاقتصادية}}, 'The Economy') is a Saudi daily newspaper,{{cite web|title=Al Eqtisadiah|url=http://www.bazaarint.com/index.php?page=shop.product_details&flypage=flypage_bz.tpl&product_id=1811&category_id=297&option=com_virtuemart&Itemid=2|work=Bazaar International|accessdate=22 May 2012}} published by Saudi Research and Publishing Company. It is published in Arabic.{{cite web|title=Saudi Arabia |url=http://www.arabpressnetwork.org/newspaysv2.php?id=129 |work=Arab Press Network |accessdate=1 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120528072145/http://www.arabpressnetwork.org/newspaysv2.php?id=129 |archivedate=28 May 2012 }} ==History== ''Al Eqtisadiah'' was first launched as an economic daily in 1962.{{cite web|title=Ideological and ownership trends in the Saudi Media|url=http://www.cablegatesearch.net/cable.php?id=09RIYADH651|work=Wikileaks|accessdate=1 May 2012|date=11 May 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130116083750/http://www.cablegatesearch.net/cable.php?id=09RIYADH651|archive-date=16 January 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} The founders of the paper were [[Hisham Hafiz]] and his brother Mohammad Hafiz.{{cite web|title=Biography |url=http://www.hishamalihafiz.com/bio.htm |work=Hisham Ali Hafiz |accessdate=22 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120722005217/http://www.hishamalihafiz.com/bio.htm |archivedate=22 July 2012 }} Later, it began to be published by Saudi Research and Publishing Company, a subsidiary of [[Saudi Research and Marketing Group]], on 12 January 1992.{{cite web|title=Al Eqtisadiah website|url=http://www.numumultimedia.com/portfolio/al-eqtisadiah-website/|work=Numu Multimedia|accessdate=5 June 2012}} The paper has a [[Gulf of Basra|Gulf]] edition. ==Target audience== ''Al Eqtisadiah'' is often called "The Financial Times of Saudi Arabia".{{cite web|title=Best Saudi company work for|url=http://www.bestsaudicompany.com/portal/content/about-list|work=BSC|accessdate=1 May 2012}} Therefore, its target population is primarily businesspeople{{cite web|title=Saudi Arabia|url=http://mediame.com/country/saudi_arabia/al_eqtisadiah|work=Media ME|accessdate=1 May 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111116111434/http://mediame.com/country/saudi_arabia/al_eqtisadiah|archive-date=16 November 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} as well as academics, and senior government employees in the Kingdom and [[Gulf Cooperation Council|the GCC]].{{cite web|title=Publications |url=http://www.srpc.com/en/publications |work=Saudi Research and Publishing Company |accessdate=1 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120430170624/http://www.srpc.com/en/publications |archivedate=30 April 2012 |df=dmy }} ''Al Eqtisadiah'' is reported to rapidly secure a loyal readership of Saudi executives and government officials.{{cite web|title=Trade promotion and advertising in Saudi Arabia|url=http://www.globaltrade.net/f/business/text/Saudi-Arabia/Selling-Distribution-Networks-Trade-Promotion-and-Advertising-in-Saudi-Arabia.html|work=Global Trade|accessdate=17 May 2012|date=24 May 2010}} The paper is also read by educated Saudi women and female students.{{cite news|title=Arabic Language Edition of BusinessWeek Launched|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/arabic-language-edition-of-businessweek-launched-55605287.html|accessdate=7 June 2015|work=PR Newswire|location=New York, Beirut}} ==Ownership== ''Al Eqtisadiah'' is one of the daily newspapers published by [http://www.srpc.com Saudi Research and Publishing Company (SRPC)], one of the Saudi Research and Marketing Group (SRMG) companies. The other daily newspapers published by SRPC are ''[[Arab News]]'' and ''[[Al-Sharq al-Awsat|Al Sharq Al Awsat]]''. The chairman of SRMG is [[Turki bin Salman Al Saud]].{{cite news|title=Saudi Research and Marketing Group appoints new chairman|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2013/02/10/265556.html|accessdate=12 February 2013|work=Al Arabiya|date=10 February 2013}} ==Content== ''Al Eqtisadiah'' is the only specialized business and financial newspaper in the Kingdom.{{cite web|title=Al Eqtisadiah |url=http://www.adnative.net/uk/represented-media/factsheet/?PARAM1=SJ1ID1&title=Al-Eqtisadiah |work=Adnative |accessdate=29 May 2012 |year=2011 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The paper provides both news coverage and research, analysis and commentary on economic and business-related events at domestic, regional and international levels. It also provides the translated articles and news from major international business publications, including the ''[[Financial Times]]'', ''[[the Harvard Business Review]]'', ''[[INSEAD]]'', and ''[[Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung|Frankfurter]]'' regarding major economic events and developments. The newspaper closely deals with consumer affairs as well as financial trends within [[Middle East|the region]] and abroad. It offers its readers opinions about their financial initiatives and investments. It monitors the developments throughout [[Saudi Arabia|the Kingdom]] by focusing on social and economic trends and uncovering important issues that have impact on communities as well as the country’s economy as a whole. Additionally, daily in-depth articles published provide an analysis of how developments may affect the Saudi economy. Although ''Al Eqtisadiah'' was founded as a financial daily paper, it is equally known for its political content, often printing editorials and opinion harshly critical of the US on a number of fronts. On the other hand, during the term of its former chief editor Abdul Wahab Al Faiz, ''Al Eqtisadiah'' a few years before 2009 appeared to return to its original finance-focus, gradually moving away from political opinion and focusing on themes of interest to the region's business elite. However, ''Al Eqtisadiah'' seems to return to the pre-Al Faiz period, since editor-in-chief Salman Al Dossari published an article challenging the [[Russia]]'s stance over Syrian government on 24 March 2012. Specifically, Al Dossari harshly criticized Russia, especially [[Sergey Lavrov]], for supporting [[Bashar Assad]] and argued that the same tactics used by Russia to oppress Muslim majority in [[Chechnya]] and the [[Caucasus]] have been used by Assad to oppress Sunni majority in [[Syria]].{{cite web|author=H. Varulkar|title=Rising Tensions between Saudi Arabia, Russia on Backdrop of Syrian Crisis|url=http://www.memri.org/report/en/0/0/0/0/189/0/6246.htm|work=MEMRI|accessdate=27 May 2012|format=Inquiry and Analysis Series Report No.820|date=4 April 2012}} The paper also contains a section on [[environmental issues]] which is published weekly.{{cite web|author=Najib Saab |title=The Environment in Arab Media |url=http://www.afedonline.org/afedreport/english/book14.pdf |work=Arab Forum for Environment and Development |accessdate=7 October 2014 |format=Report |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141010170621/http://www.afedonline.org/afedreport/english/book14.pdf |archivedate=10 October 2014 }} ==Circulation== ''Al Eqtisadiah'' had a circulation of 76,928 copies in the beginning of the 2000s.{{cite web|title=Saudi Arabia Press|url=http://www.pressreference.com/Sa-Sw/Saudi-Arabia.html|work=Press Reference|accessdate=27 September 2013}} Its 2007 circulation was about 60,000 copies.{{cite web|title=Saudi Arabia. Media market description|url=http://www.ihudaif.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/WORLD-ASSOCIATION-OF-NEWSPAPERS-%E2%80%93-WORLD-PRESS-TRENDS-2008.pdf|work=World Association of Newspapers|accessdate=16 May 2012|year=2008|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130921062852/http://www.ihudaif.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/WORLD-ASSOCIATION-OF-NEWSPAPERS-%E2%80%93-WORLD-PRESS-TRENDS-2008.pdf|archive-date=21 September 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} The paper's website was the eighth among top 63 online newspapers of the Arab world in a ranking published by ''Forbes Middle East'' magazine in 2011.{{cite news|title=Al Eqtisadiah ranked among top online dailies.|url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/Al-Eqtisadiah+ranked+among+top+online+dailies.-a0273684221|accessdate=22 May 2012|newspaper=Arab News|year=2011}}{{cite news|title=Forbes Middle East unveils ranking of Top 63 online newspapers of the Arab world|url=http://www.albawaba.com/business/pr/forbes-middle-east-unveils-ranking-top-63-online-newspapers-arab-world-403144|accessdate=2 June 2012|work=Forbes Middle East|date=29 November 2011}} ==Chief editors== Former [[editor-in-chief]] of ''Al Eqtisadiah'' was Muhammad Faraj Al Tunisi, who resigned due to personal reasons in 2003. He had been in this post since 1992. Abdul Wahap Al Faiz was the chief editor of ''Al Eqtisadiah'' from 2003 to October 2011 and he was made editor-in-chief of ''[[Arab News]]'' in October 2011, replacing [[Khaled Almaeena|Khalid Almaeena]].{{cite news|title=Al Faiz new editor in chief of Arab News |url=http://en-maktoob.news.yahoo.com/al-faiz-editor-chief-arab-news-230503584.html |accessdate=10 May 2012 |newspaper=Arab News |date=8 October 2011 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} New chief editor of ''Al Eqtisadiah'' is Salman bin Yousuf Al Dossary, appointed in October 2011.[http://english.aawsat.com/2014/07/article55333868/salman-al-dossary-appointed-asharq-al-awsat-editor-in-chief Salman Al Dossary appointed Asharq Al Awsat editor in chief] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304103249/http://english.aawsat.com/2014/07/article55333868/salman-al-dossary-appointed-asharq-al-awsat-editor-in-chief |date=4 March 2016 }} ''Asharq Al Awsat''. 2 July 2014. Retrieved 19 October 2015. Al Dossari was working as assistant editor in chief of ''[[Asharq Al-Awsat|Asharq al Awsat]]'' before his appointment.{{cite web|title=Al Faiz new editor in chief of Arab News|url=http://www.srpc.com/en/node/44|date= 12 November 2011|work=Saudi Research and Publishing Company|accessdate=11 January 2017}} ==TV channel== There is also a TV channel bearing the same name, Al Eqtisadiah TV, that broadcasts economy news.{{cite web|title=Al Eqtisadiah TV|url=http://www.bizontv.com/2011/09/al-eqtisadiah-tv-saudi.html|work=Bizon TV|accessdate=22 May 2012|date=September 2011}} The channel launched its [[YouTube]] channel in November 2012.{{cite news|title=Prince Faisal launches new Al Eqtisadiah website|url=http://www.arabnews.com/prince-faisal-launches-new-al-eqtisadiah-website|accessdate=12 January 2013|newspaper=Arab News|date=18 November 2012}} ==See also== [[List of newspapers in Saudi Arabia]] ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=33em}} ==External links== * [http://www.pressdisplay.com/pressdisplay/tr/viewer.aspx ''Al Eqtisadiah'' daily] ''Press Display'' {{DEFAULTSORT:Eqtisadiah, Al}} [[Category:1962 establishments in Saudi Arabia]] [[Category:Arabic-language newspapers]] [[Category:Business newspapers]] [[Category:Media in Riyadh]] [[Category:Newspapers published in Saudi Arabia]] [[Category:Publications established in 1962]]

{{EngvarB|date=October 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2017}} [[File:Alexander Ariipaea Salmon.jpg|thumb|200px|Alexander Salmon, Jr., c. 1885.]] '''Alexander Ari{{okina}}ipaea Vehiaitipare Salmon Jr.''' (1855–1914) was the English-Jewish-Tahitian co-owner of the Maison Brander plantations on [[Tahiti]] and ''de facto'' ruler of [[Easter Island]] from 1878 till its cession to [[Chile]] in 1888.
==Family== Salmon's father, [[Alexander Salmon]] (Solomon, 1822–1866), was an English Jewish merchant. While secretary to [[Pomare IV|Pōmare IV]] of Tahiti, he fell in love with her twenty-year-old adoptive sister Oehau. For three days the queen cancelled the law forbidding a Tahitian to marry a foreigner, gave Princess Oehau the title ''[[Aliʻi|ari'i]]'' Taimai, and they married.
Their daughter, Salmon's sister, [[Queen Marau|Johanna Marau Ta'aroa]] (1846–1934),<ref>[http://www.guide2womenleaders.com/womeninpower/Womeninpower1870.htm Women Leaders]</ref> married her uncle, the future King [[Pōmare V]], and was ''de facto'' ruler as Queen Marau (1877–1880) until he abdicated to the French colonial government. Another daughter married the Scottish merchant [[John Brander (merchant)|John Brander]].
Their son, Alexander Jr, known as "Pa'ea" (Mangarevan for 'hobble'), inherited his father's business interests and became co-owner with Brander of the ''Maison Brander'' [[copra]] and [[coconut oil]] plantations in Tahiti, the [[Marquesas]], and the [[Cook Islands|Cooks]].
==Easter Island== The ''Maison Brander'' owned a large sheep ranch on Easter Island for exporting wool. The ranch was managed by the power-hungry convicted murderer [[Jean-Baptiste Dutrou-Bornier]], who had acquired additional land and appointed his [[Rapanui]] wife "Queen". This was the low point in the island's history; by 1872 its resident population had been reduced to 111.
In 1871 Alexander Jr had picked up rudimentary [[Rapanui language|Rapanui]] from his hundreds of indentured Easter Island labourers at the [[Mahina, French Polynesia|Mahina]] coconut plantation on Tahiti. In 1877 Queen Pōmare IV died, and Alexander's sister became regent. John Brander also died that year, and Dutrou-Bornier was assassinated. Alexander set off for Easter Island to manage the sheep station in around October 1878 with twenty Tahitian workers and an unknown number of Rapanui whose indentures had expired and ran the island for a decade. He introduced the [[coconut]], the first sizeable tree on the island since its deforestation two centuries earlier, apart from some fruit trees at the [[Congregation of the Sacred Hearts of Jesus and Mary|SSCC]] Catholic mission and Dutrou-Bornier's estate.
Salmon returned to Tahiti in 1883–1884 for business. Upon his return to Easter Island he bought up all remaining land apart from the SSCC mission at [[Hanga Roa]]. As owner of nearly all the island and sole source of employment, Salmon was ''de facto'' ruler.
As he was not a religious man, and a Jew, the priests did not like him, especially [[Hippolyte Roussel]], who had been forced to leave the island in 1871 due to conflict with Dutrou-Bornier but who visited again in 1879. Bishop [[Florentin-Étienne Jaussen|Jaussen]] in Tahiti appointed a Rapanui, [[Atamu te Kena]], "king" to protect church interests from the ''Maison Brander'', but Salmon ignored him and he never had any influence. However, Salmon was an honest man and sincerely interested in the welfare of the people, and the population started to recover. This was the era of the strong Tahitian influence on the Rapanui language and culture.
In addition to wool exports, Salmon developed a tourist industry. He encouraged the manufacture of Rapanui artworks, including imitation ''[[rongorongo]]'' inscriptions, and helped sell them to passing ships for good prices as cultural artefacts, though he never claimed they were genuine. The artisans knew currency exchange rates and could deal with Europeans and Americans on their own terms.
Salmon served as the principal informant for the British and [[:de:SMS Hyäne|German archaeological expeditions]] to the island in 1882 and for the Americans in 1886, as guide, translator, and hotelier.
Cooke, surgeon of the [[USS Mohican (1883)|USS ''Mohican'']], which dropped anchor in December 1886, said,<ref>Fischer pp 131–132</ref>
{{quotation|Mr Salmon, who is guide, philosopher, and friend to these people, unites in his person (and being a giant in stature, he can well contain them) the duties of referee, arbiter, judge. They entertain the greatest respect for him; evince the utmost affection; look up to him as their master; go to him with all their troubles; refer to him all their disputes and grievances. His word is law, and his decisions final and undisputed.}}
The information Salmon provided, despite its often poor quality, is still among the most important of Easter Island's early historical period. He also sent three genuine ''rongorongo'' tablets to his niece's husband, Heinrich August Schlubach, the German consul of [[Valparaíso]], which are now kept in Vienna and Berlin.
[[File:Prince Kuhio with Alexander Ariipaea Salmon (PP-97-1-048).jpg|thumb|Salmon with Hawaiian [[Jonah Kūhiō Kalanianaʻole|Prince Kūhiō]] in 1907]] Salmon sold the Brander Easter Island holdings to the Chilean government on 2 January 1888 and signed as a witness to the cession of the island. He returned to Tahiti in December of that year. He left for the remote [[Tuamotus|Tuamotu Islands]] after being arrested and put in prison for assault and battery. He collected the oral histories of the people of the Tuamotus. He moved to San Francisco in later life and was involved in a scheme to marry ex-Queen [[Liliuokalani]] of Hawaii, who he claimed he had been engaged to from birth. The plot was merely a heist to take Liliuokalani's money to pay his debt. He died in 1914.<ref>[http://www.tandfonline.com/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/cjph20/2005/cjph20.v040.i02/00223340500176574/production/images/medium/cjph_a_10043846_o_art001.gif Tandfonline]</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2015}} {{Use Australian English|date=August 2015}} {{Infobox person | image = | name = Bee Taechaubol | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1975|9|12|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Thailand]] | death_date = | death_place = | education = [[Newington College]]
[[University of New South Wales]]
[[Chulalongkorn University]] | occupation = Businessman | known_for = Founder of ''Thai Prime Company Limited'' | spouse = Susie | parents = | children = 2 children | nationality = | website = Thai }} '''Bee Taechaubol''' (born 12 September 1975) is a Thai businessman and founder of Thai Prime Company Limited.{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=24657441&ticker=EIC:TB&previousCapId=20385132&previousTitle=ELECTRONICS%20INDUSTRY%20PCL|title=Bee Taechaubol: Executive Profile & Biography - Businessweek|work=Businessweek.com|accessdate=18 May 2015}} He specializes in private equity investment in public companies, personally overseeing the turn around and growth of the businesses he is involved in. ==Education== Taechaubol spent his high school years in [[Sydney, Australia]], where he attended [[Newington College]] (1987–1992).Newington College Register of Past Students 1863-1998 (Syd, 1999) pp 193 He has a degree in Civil Engineering from the [[University of New South Wales]] (1998) and an MBA from [[Chulalongkorn University]] (2000).{{cite web|url=http://www.theworldfolio.com/news/bee-taechaubol-local-entrepreneur-thailand-n2226/2226/|title=Thai entrepreneur Bee Taechaubol brings investment to local SMEs|author=The Worldfolio|work=theworldfolio.com|accessdate=18 May 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1717/editorial/2015/05/04/11355622/from-dishwasher-to-billionaire-mr-bee-only-had-eyes-for-ac|title=From dishwasher to billionaire: Mr Bee only had eyes for AC Milan|work=Goal.com|accessdate=18 May 2015}} ==Business interests== Thai Prime Company Limited is a South-East Asian based Private Equity group, founded by Taechaubol. Thai Prime has interests in a number of sectors, including financial services, construction, property, technology, parking, traffic infrastructure, sports and payment gateways. These interests are primarily South-East Asian centric, but extend across Asia, China and into Australia.{{cite web|url=http://www.financeasia.com/News/395061,thai-sibling-rivalry-generates-deals.aspx|title=Thai sibling rivalry generates deals|work=FinanceAsia|accessdate=18 May 2015}} Thai Prime operates by acquiring, holding and developing assets over the longer-term. Current holdings include K-Tech Construction Public Company Limited, Electronics Industry Public Company Limited, Country Group Development Public Company Limited, Smart Traffic Company Limited and Asia Park Company Limited. Thai Prime is also acquiring a land bank in Central Bangkok that will soon be under development across a number of real estate segments. ==Football== In 2014, Taechaubol acquired the exclusive rights as sole organizer across Asia for the Global Legends Series, a four-game series bringing together legendary football players from around the world. These players play against each other in a Legends vs. Legends four-match series in different cities across the world. Players include [[Fabio Cannavaro]], [[Michael Owen]], [[Luis Figo]], [[Cafu]] and [[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]] amongst others. The Global Legends Series inaugural match took place on 5 December 2014 in [[Bangkok, Thailand]]. Launched with a ceremony to honour his Majesty King Bhumibhol Adulyadej’s 87th birthday, the event was broadcast across the globe to more than 200 million viewers.{{cite web|url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/sports/Legends-of-the-game-set-to-kick-off-in-Thailand-30246381.html|title=Legends of the game set to kick off in Thailand|date=28 October 2014|work=The Nation|accessdate=18 May 2015}} In unison with Global Legends Series, legacy and youth programs are delivered to the countries played in, with long-term programs running in countries such as China, partnering with the country’s Ministry of Education to deliver football to 200 million children over eight years old. On June 5, 2015, it was announced that Bee Taechaubol will purchase a 48% stake in Italian football club [[A.C. Milan]], pending further negotiations that are expected to take up to eight weeks for approval.{{cite web|url=http://www.acmilan.com/it/news/breaking_news_show/79954|title=Breaking News: COMUNICATO CONGIUNTO|work=acmilan.com}} However, the deal collapsed after Silvio Berlusconi decided to sell 100% of the club instead, following a heart attack.{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/ac-milan-takeover-chinese-millionaire-mr-bee-taechaubol-a7804306.html|title=The AC Milan takeover that never was: how Silvio Berlusconi's change of heart changed everything for Mr Bee|date=2017-06-23|work=The Independent|access-date=2017-07-20|language=en-GB}} ==Personal life== Taechaubol is married{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/milaneye/status/593703886420123648|title=Milan Fans ★ on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=18 May 2015}} {{reliable source|date=October 2017|reason=a tweet of an unknown person}} and has two children. He spends most of his time in [[Bangkok]], Thailand, where his holding company Thai Prime is based. Besides his professional career, he is also the Global Ambassador for The Nourafchan Foundation, the world’s first participatory, open-source philanthropy whose mission is to improve the human condition. Recent projects include several infrastructure and education projects for orphans and those impoverished in Kenya’s largest slum, Kibera.{{cite web|url=http://nourafchan.com/initiatives/kibera-slum-and-rec-school/|title=KIBERA SLUM & REC SCHOOL|author=Promoting Group|work=nourafchan.com|access-date=18 May 2015}} Bee Taechaubol is the son of Sadawut Taechaubol.http://www.quotenet.nl/Nieuws/Wie-is-Ben-Taechaubol-de-investeerder-die-dit-weekend-AC-Milan-overneemt-151286 ==Family business== Taechaubol’s family controls Country Group, a leading property development company in Thailand for over 30 years. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Taechaubol, Bee}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Thai businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Bangkok]] [[Category:People educated at Newington College]] [[Category:University of New South Wales alumni]] [[Category:Chulalongkorn University alumni]] [[Category:Thai people of Chinese descent]]

{{Redirect|Castle Garden|the unincorporated community in Indiana|Castle Garden, Indiana}} {{Use mdy dates|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox NRHP | name = Castle Clinton National Monument
Castle Garden | nrhp_type = nmon | image = Habs castle clinton.jpg | image_size = 300px | caption = Castle Clinton in Battery Park
Photo: [[Historic American Buildings Survey]] | locmapin =Lower Manhattan#United States Manhattan#New York#USA | map_caption = | coordinates = {{coord|40.7035|-74.0168|region:US-NY_type:landmark_dim:3km|display=title}} | location = [[Battery Park]], [[Manhattan]], [[New York City]] | built = 1808 | architect = [[John McComb, Jr.]]; Jonathan Williams; U.S. War Department | architecture = | added = October 15, 1966{{NRISref|2009a}} | designated_nrhp_type = August 12, 1946 | area = {{convert|1|acre|ha}} | visitation_num = 2,949,231 | visitation_year = 2004 | refnum = 66000537 | mpsub = | governing_body = [[National Park Service]] | website = [https://www.nps.gov/cacl Castle Clinton National Monument] | designated_other2_name = NYC Landmark | designated_other2_date = November 23, 1965 | designated_other2_abbr = NYCL | designated_other2_link = New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission | designated_other2_number = | designated_other2_color = #ffe978 }} '''Castle Clinton''' or '''Fort Clinton''', previously known as '''Castle Garden''', is a circular [[sandstone]] [[fort]] now located in [[Battery Park]], in [[Manhattan]], [[New York City]]. It is perhaps best remembered as [[History of immigration to the United States|America's first immigration station]] (predating [[Ellis Island]]), where more than 8 million people arrived in the United States from 1855 to 1890. Over its active life, it has also functioned as a [[beer garden]], [[exhibition hall]], [[theater]], and [[public aquarium]], and currently is a [[U.S. National Monument|national monument]]. ==Historic use== Castle Clinton stands approximately two blocks west of where [[Fort Amsterdam]] was built in 1626, when New York City was known by the Dutch name [[New Amsterdam]]. Construction began in 1808 and was completed in 1811. The fort, known as West Battery (sometimes Southwest Battery), was designed by architects [[John McComb, Jr.]] and [[Jonathan Williams (engineer)|Jonathan Williams]]. It was built on a small [[artificial island]] just off shore. West Battery was intended to complement the three-tiered [[Castle Williams]] on [[Governors Island]], which was East Battery, to defend New York City from [[United Kingdom|British]] forces in the tensions that marked the run-up to the [[War of 1812]], but it never saw action in that or any war. Subsequent [[Land reclamation|landfill]] expanded Battery Park, and the fort was incorporated into the mainland of Manhattan Island. Castle Clinton National Monument was listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]] on October 15, 1966. ==19th century== [[File:JunkKeyingView70.jpg|thumb|''The Bay and Harbor of New York'' by [[Samuel Waugh]] (1814–1885), depicting the castle in 1848]] [[File:Castle Garden theater 1824.jpg|thumb|First Appearance of [[Jenny Lind]] in America, at Castle Garden, September 11, 1850 (Engraving by [[Currier and Ives]])]] [[File:Castle Garden aerial view ca1880.jpg|thumb|Aerial view illustration of Manhattan, showing Castle Garden at its tip, ca. 1880]] [[File:Battery Park 002.jpg|thumb|The [[New York City Aquarium]] was once housed at Castle Garden (image before 1923)]] West Battery was renamed Castle Clinton in 1815, its current official name, in honor of [[Mayor of New York City|New York City Mayor]] [[DeWitt Clinton]] (who eventually became [[Governor of New York]]). The [[United States Army]] stopped using the fort in 1821, and it was leased to New York City as a place of public entertainment. It opened as Castle Garden on July 3, 1824, a name by which it was popularly known for most of its existence, even to the present time. It served in turn as a [[promenade]], [[beer garden]]/[[restaurant]], [[exhibition hall]], [[opera house]], and [[theater (structure)|theater]]. Designed as an open-air structure, it was eventually roofed over to accommodate these uses. In 1850, the castle was the site of two concerts given for charity by Swedish [[soprano]] [[Jenny Lind]] to initiate her American tour. A year later, European dancing star [[Lola Montez]] performed her notorious "tarantula dance" in Castle Garden. In 1853–54, [[Louis-Antoine Jullien]], the eccentric French conductor and composer of light music, gave dozens of very successful concerts mixing classical and light music. The [[Max Maretzek Italian Opera Company]] notably staged the New York premieres of [[Gaetano Donizetti]]'s ''[[Marino Faliero (opera)|Marino Faliero]]'' on June 17, 1851, and [[Giuseppe Verdi]]'s ''[[Luisa Miller]]'' on July 20, 1854, at Castle Garden.Brodsky Lawrence pg. 314George Whitney Martin pg. 184 ==Immigration holding center== In the first half of the 19th century, most immigrants arriving in New York City landed at docks on the east side of the tip of Manhattan, around [[South Street Seaport|South Street]]. On August 1, 1855, Castle Clinton became the Emigrant Landing Depot, functioning as the [[New York (state)|New York]] State immigrant processing center (the nation's first such entity). It was operated by the state until April 18, 1890,[http://genealogy.about.com/od/ports/p/castle_garden.htm About.com, "Castle Garden – America's First Official Immigration Center"] when the [[U. S. government]] assumed control of immigration processing, soon moving the center to the larger, more isolated [[Ellis Island]] facility on January 2, 1892. The new facility was needed because immigrants were known to carry diseases, which led to epidemics of [[Cholera outbreaks and pandemics|cholera]] and [[smallpox]]. After many unnecessary deaths, and scandals over immigration workers cheating and stealing from immigrants, the immigration center was moved to Ellis Island.{{Cite book|title=Transforming America: Perspectives on U.S. Immigration|last=LeMay|first=Michael|publisher=ABC-CLIO, LLC|year=2013|isbn=978-0-313-39643-4|location=Santa Barbara, California|pages=204–206|quote=|via=}} Most of Castle Clinton's immigrant passenger records were destroyed in a fire that consumed the first structures on Ellis Island on June 15, 1897,{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1897/06/15/archives/fire-on-ellis-island-it-broke-out-shortly-after-midnight-in-the.html|title=FIRE ON ELLIS ISLAND; It Broke Out Shortly After Midnight in the Furnace of the Main Building. THE FIREBOAT NEW YORKER AND POLICE BOAT PATROL HAVE GONE TO THE SCENE. Communication With Island Was Cut Off -- It Was Reported that All Persons Escaped With Their Lives.|date=1897-06-15|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-22|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} but it is generally accepted that over 8 million immigrants (and perhaps as many as 12 million) were processed during its operation. Called ''{{lang|de|Kesselgarten}}'' by Yiddish-speaking Eastern European Jews, a ''{{lang|de|Kesselgarten}}'' became a generic term for any situation that was noisy, confusing or chaotic, or where a "[[wikt:babel|babel]]" of languages was spoken (a reference to the multitude of languages heard spoken by the immigrants from many countries at the site).{{citation needed|date=August 2016|reason=Beyond Castle Garden?}} Prominent persons associated with the administration of the immigrant station included [[Gulian Crommelin Verplanck]], [[Friedrich Kapp]], and [[John Alexander Kennedy]]. ==20th century to present== From 1896 to 1941, Castle Garden was the site of the [[New York City Aquarium]]. For many years, it was the city's most popular attraction, drawing hundreds of thousands of visitors each year. The structure was extensively altered and roofed over to a height of several stories, though the original masonry fort remained. In 1941, [[Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority]] Commissioner [[Robert Moses]] wanted to tear the structure down completely, claiming that this was necessary to build the [[Brooklyn–Battery Tunnel]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1941/02/08/archives/battery-aquarium-to-be-demolished-doomed-by-brooklyn-tunnel-it-will.html|title=BATTERY AQUARIUM TO BE DEMOLISHED; Doomed by Brooklyn Tunnel, It Will Be Replaced by a Modern One in Bronx COST PUT AT $2,000,000 Modern Exhibition Technique to Be Utilized to Mirror Nature, Osborn Says|date=February 8, 1941|work=The New York Times|access-date=March 21, 2018|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} To expedite construction of the tunnel, the city closed the New York Aquarium and moved its fish to other aquariums in September 1941.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1941/09/23/archives/fish-to-leave-old-home-aquarium-to-start-dispersing-thousands-of.html|title=FISH TO LEAVE OLD HOME; Aquarium to Start Dispersing Thousands of Specimens|date=September 23, 1941|work=The New York Times|access-date=March 21, 2018|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} Moses advocated for the demolition of Castle Clinton,{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1942/06/26/archives/aquarium-doomed-by-estimate-board-moses-scoffs-at-proposal-to.html|title=AQUARIUM DOOMED BY ESTIMATE BOARD; Moses Scoffs at Proposal to Restore Old Fort, Saying It 'Never Fired a Shot' MANY PLEAD FOR SAVING IT But the Vote Is 11 to 5 for Demolition to Make Way for Battery Tunnel|date=June 26, 1942|work=The New York Times|access-date=March 22, 2018|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} but preservationists who opposed Moses's proposed action asked federal judge to grant an injunction to prevent demolition.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1942/08/20/archives/injunction-sought-to-save-aquarium-suit-today-will-ask-court-to.html|title=INJUNCTION SOUGHT TO SAVE AQUARIUM; Suit Today Will Ask Court to Restrain Moses From Razing Fort Clinton|date=August 20, 1942|work=The New York Times|access-date=March 22, 2018|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} Even though Moses initially got the injunction dismissed,{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1943/04/25/archives/moses-wins-fight-to-raze-aquarium-court-of-appeals-has-denied.html|title=MOSES WINS FIGHT TO RAZE AQUARIUM; Court of Appeals Has Denied Injunction Sought by Civic Groups Opposing Him ACTION WAS BEGUN IN 1941 Contest Was Marked by Fierce Exchange Between Park Chief and Pierce T. Wetter|date=1943-04-25|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-22|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} the public outcry prevented his effort at demolition. However, the aquarium was closed and not replaced until Moses opened a new facility on [[Coney Island]] in 1957.Author: [[Caro, Robert A.]], ''[[The Power Broker]]: Robert Moses and the Fall of New York''. New York, Knopf, 1974. {{ISBN|0-394-72024-5}} [[Albert S. Bard]], [[Walter D. Binger]], and other civic reformers advocated to save the castle, which resulted in both houses of the [[United States Congress]] to pass legislation to make the castle a U.S. historic monument.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1946/07/31/archives/senate-approves-the-aquarium-bill-measure-to-set-up-the-castle.html|title=SENATE APPROVES THE AQUARIUM BILL; Measure to Set Up the Castle Clinton National Monument Is Sent to Truman M'ANENY DEFENDS MOVE Disputes Park Association's Opposition to the Acquisition, Denies Tunnel Interference McAneny Defends Project Plymouth Rock|date=1946-07-31|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-22|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} President [[Harry S. Truman]] signed the legislation on August 12, 1946.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1946/08/13/archives/aquarium-block-made-a-monument-truman-signs-bill-designating-castle.html|title=AQUARIUM BLOCK MADE A MONUMENT; Truman Signs Bill Designating Castle Clinton, Battery Park, a National Shrine|date=1946-08-13|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-22|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} Although Castle Garden had been designated a national monument, the city still owned the property. In July 1947, the [[New York City Board of Estimate]] voted to demolish Castle Garden.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1947/07/25/archives/city-votes-death-of-old-aquarium-5year-controversy-is-ended-as.html|title=CITY VOTES DEATH OF OLD AQUARIUM; 5-Year Controversy Is Ended as Board of Estimate Allots $50,000 for Demolition MOSES SCORES A VICTORY Final Blow to Memorial Plan Results From Lack of U.S. Funds for Restoration CITY VOTES DEATH OF OLD AQUARIUM|last=Crowelx|first=Paul|date=1947-07-25|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-22|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} However, the Board delayed the demolition for another year to allow the federal government to review the decision.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1947/08/28/archives/city-to-give-government-chance-to-prevent-aquarium-demolition-board.html|title=City to Give Government Chance To Prevent Aquarium Demolition; Board of Estimate Agrees to Delay Razing of Castle Clinton to Permit Congress to Vote Funds for Restoration|date=1947-08-28|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-22|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} In May 1948, the Board voted to demolish the castle for the sixth time in as many years.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1948/05/28/archives/estimate-board-votes-to-complete-demolition-of-old-aquarium-here.html|title=Estimate Board Votes to Complete Demolition of Old Aquarium Here; DEMOLITION VOTED FOR OLD AQUARIUM|date=1948-05-28|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-22|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} After another year of discussion, the [[New York State Assembly]] reversed its decision to allow the castle to be demolished.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1949/03/16/archives/restoration-voted-for-castle-clinton-assembly-committee-clears-bill.html|title=RESTORATION VOTED FOR CASTLE CLINTON; Assembly Committee Clears Bill Making Possible a U. S. Monument at the Battery GROUP REVERSES' 48 STAND Floor Action Is Expected Next Week on Measure Allowing City to Relinquish Title|date=1949-03-16|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-22|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} The federal government finally obtained the property on July 18, 1950, after the city deeded the land and castle to the federal government.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1950/07/19/archives/aquarium-becomes-a-us-monument-action-on-castle-clinton-at-battery.html|title=AQUARIUM BECOMES A U.S. MONUMENT; Action on Castle Clinton at Battery Taken After City Deeds Site to Government MUCH WORK TO BE DONE Building Started in 1808 Now Only a Shell--$166,750 in Restoration Funds Work Started in 1808 Announcement Is Hailed|date=1950-07-19|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-22|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} A major rehabilitation took place in the 1970s. It is currently administered by the [[National Park Service]] and is a departure point for visitors to the [[Statue of Liberty]] and Ellis Island. It appears today much as it did in its earliest days; it has a museum and is again called Castle Clinton.{{clear left}} ==Notes== ==References== * [http://www.nps.gov/history/history/online_books/elis/castle_garden.pdf ''Castle Garden as an Immigrant Depot, 1855–1890,''] by George J Svejda (1968) * ''Castle Garden and Battery Park'' by Barry Moreno (2007) * [https://books.google.com/books?id=Q_YsAAAAYAAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=%22Guide+to+the+New+York+Aquarium%22&source=bl&ots=ITb3f3CZTw&sig=XynO3pWcoti5ip8w8zt7NLChJec&hl=en&ei=coFpTcXWJZL3gAepm-TLCg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CBQQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q&f=false ''Guide to the New York Aquarium''] by [[Charles Haskins Townsend|Charles H. {{Multiple issues| {{globalize|date=September 2013}} {{Citation style|date=November 2014}} }} {{course assignment | course = Education Program:University College London/MSIN1003 Information World (Autumn 2014) | term = 2014 Q3}} A '''chief learning officer''' ('''CLO''') is the highest-ranking [[corporate officer]] in charge of learning management. CLOs may be experts in corporate or personal training, with degrees in education, instructional design, business or similar fields.
Qualified CLOs should be able to drive the corporate strategy and align the development of people with the business goals of the organization. A full complement of skills, including business analytics, technology, learning theory, performance consulting and scientific inquiry, are important for success.<ref>[http://www.bersin.com/blog/post.aspx?id=de0e7229-d688-4746-8736-5817482885c8 Bersin by Deloitte: Today's World-Class Chief Learning Officer]</ref>
The CLO may report directly to the [[CEO]], but may also report to the Head of [[Human Relations|HR]] or Chief Talent Officer.
==Background== In the 1990s, [[Jack Welch]], then CEO of [[GE]], made Steve Kerr his CLO, making GE the first company to have such an officer.<ref>"Steve Kerr and His Years with Jack Welch at GE", ''Journal of Management Inquiry'', December 2002, 11: 343-350</ref> Kerr also became the CLO and Managing Director for [[Goldman Sachs]]
=== Promotion === In 2012, Emma Cunis, executive director of the [[Chartered Institute of Management Accountants]] spoke at a CLO summit held in [[Mumbai]]. Cunis was part of a panel that discussed the cost of not investing in executive [[Training and development|learning and development]]. She quoted former General Electric CEO Jack Welch to make her case: "The Jack Welch of the future cannot be like me. I spent my entire career in the United States. The next head of General Electric will be someone who spent time in Bombay, in Hong Kong, in Buenos Aires…. We have to send our best and brightest overseas and make sure they have the training that will allow them to be global leaders who will make GE flourish in the future."<ref>[http://knowledge.wharton.upenn.edu/india/article.cfm?articleid=4716 Wharton University: "India Learns the Value of the Chief Learning Officer"]</ref>
==Learning techniques== There are four types of learning techniques that may be employed by CLOs (Elkeles & Phillips, 2007):<ref>{{cite book|last1=Jack, Tamar|first1=Phillips, Elkeles|title=The Chief Learning Officer|publisher=Butterworth-Heinemann|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Vb8JBAAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&hl=ko&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=onepage&q&f=false}}</ref> ; Coaching : Coaching refers to the training and development process wherein the CLO will support and train an individual or team in achieving a specific skill, competence, or goal. The individual or team receiving the coaching may be referred to as the coachee(s) (Flaherty, 2010).<ref>{{cite book|last1=Flaherty|first1=James|title=Coaching: Evoking Excellence in Others|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=5Nfv94keo5cC&printsec=frontcover&dq=inauthor:%22James+Flaherty%22&hl=ko&sa=X&ei=ObVSVNGaF83xavS5gvAM&ved=0CCEQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q&f=false|website=Google e-book|publisher=Elsevier Inc|accessdate=28 October 2014}}</ref> :The higher value for a CLO, relative to coaching, is to create a culture of coaching. All managers should become proficient coaches, and data on personal performance and contribution should be available to them. The more informed they are, the better coaches they can be. ; Engagement : Engagement refers to the process of being psychologically invested in the learning process. It is often seen as an indicator of success in learning and the CLO will often attempt to maximize engagement of students and measure engagement during a variety of different learning tasks in order to rate their effectiveness (Christenson et.al., 2012).<ref>{{cite book|last1=Christenson, Wylie, Reschly|first1=Sandra, Cathy, Amy|title=Handbook of Research on Student Engagement|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=7LSxRvDF-RgC&printsec=frontcover&hl=ko&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=onepage&q&f=false|publisher=Springer Science & Business Media.|accessdate=30 October 2014}}</ref> :Many CHROs have found the engagement surveys to be less than useful, because: they capture only a point in time, you tend to only find out what's wrong, the cycle time from survey to action is often long enough to make taking action irrelevant. ; Mentoring : Mentoring refers to a personal development relationship in which one more experienced individual will assist a less experienced learning in acquiring a new skill, ability, or competency. This process involves communication and is relationship based. It may be said to include formal transfers of knowledge, social capital, and psychological support (Clutterbuck & Garvey, 2006).<ref>{{cite book|last1=Clutterbuck, Garvey|first1=David, Bob|title=Mentoring in Action: A Practical Guide for Managers|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=w9IO4CgMVREC&pgis=1&redir_esc=y|publisher=Kogan Page Publishers|accessdate=30 October 2014}}</ref> ; Management training : Management training activities are those activities which specifically relate to improving the management of people. CLOs may also be responsible for providing training and measuring success of skills and competencies related to management functions (Bonner, 2000).<ref>{{cite book|last1=Bonner|first1=Ded|title=Leading Knowledge Management and Learning|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ISWqgaRpaAwC&pgis=1&redir_esc=y|publisher=American Society for Training and Development|accessdate=30 October 2014}}</ref>
==Measurement techniques== Measurement techniques refer to how CLOs measure learning outcome success. These may take several forms and can include standardized tests, one-to-one interviews and discussions with individuals receiving learning assistance, surveys and questionnaires, and measured competency at various tasks before and after the learning activity (Rani, 2004; Rauner & Maclean, 2008).<ref>{{cite book|last1=Rani|first1=T. Swarupa|title=Educational Measurement and Evaluation|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=CRt893qk8c4C&printsec=frontcover&hl=ko&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=onepage&q&f=false|publisher=Discovery Publishing House|accessdate=30 October 2014}}</ref> The aim of the use of these measurement techniques is to quantify the success of the learning activity. This allows the CLO to adapt learning activities in future to increase the level of successful outcomes (Jonassen et al., 2008).<ref>{{cite book|last1=Jonassen, Spector, Driscoll, Merrill, Merrienboer|first1=David, Michael, Marcy, M.David, Jeroen|title=Handbook of Research for Educational Communications and Technology|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=GgCPAgAAQBAJ&pgis=1&redir_esc=y|publisher=Routledge|accessdate=30 October 2014}}</ref>
==Technology used== A wide variety of different technologies may be used by CLOs in order to meet their learning objectives. Popular technologies used include the use of computer software to deliver lessons and tests. Additionally, internet based learning may be used to provide learning at remote locations and enable students to engage with lessons remotely (Iskander, 2008; Facer, 2011).<ref>{{cite book|last1=Iskander|first1=Magued|title=Innovative Techniques in Instruction Technology, E-learning, E-assessment and Education|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ngQH8S7Zx0gC&pgis=1&redir_esc=y|publisher=Springer Science & Business Media.|accessdate=30 October 2014}}</ref>
==Doctoral Program== The [[University of Pennsylvania]] has their own Doctoral Program under their Graduate School of Education called the PennCLO Executive Doctoral Program. It specially prepares the Chief Learning Officers and other senior-level Human Capital Executives for success in their role as learning and talent development leaders.<ref>[http://www.pennclo.com/ PennCLO: Executive Doctoral Program]</ref>
==CLO Data== There is scant data when it comes to the CLO position, considering that the position has only existed since 1991. In terms of salary, [[Indeed.com]] reports that the average salary is roughly $81,000<ref>[http://www.indeed.com/salary?q1=Chief+Learning+Officer&l1=]</ref> per year, as of May 2015. According to a CLO survey conducted in April 2015,<ref>[http://elearningmind.com/chief-learning-officer/ Chief Learning Officer Industry Survey 2015: Infographic]</ref> roughly 45% of CLOs are female, which is a remarkably strong number for female representation in the c-suite. As a comparison, just 3%<ref>[http://www.strategyand.pwc.com/media/file/Strategyand_The-2013-Chief-Executive-Study.pdf]</ref> of CEOs are female, according to Pricewaterhouse Coopers.
==Role within the C-Suite== The chief learning officer often works alongside the CEO and collaborates on his or her vision for instituting learning and development initiatives throughout the company. Occasionally the CLO will work closely with the [[chief technology officer]], because much of L&D involves technological advancement. The [[chief knowledge officer]] will also assist the CLO in disseminating knowledge for employees to learn and apply. The chief culture officer will assist the CLO with any culture-based programs or initiatives, though most companies do not have a CCO at the moment.
==Publications== <!-- Please keep in alphabetical order --> Academic and practitioner publications dealing exclusively with CLO roles and responsibilities: * ''[[Chief Learning Officer (magazine)|Chief Learning Officer]]''<ref>http://www.clomedia.com/</ref> * ''[[Learning Executive Briefing]]'' <ref>https://www.td.org/Publications/Newsletters/LX-Briefing</ref>
Related publications: * ''[[Learning Solutions Magazine]]'' <ref>http://www.learningsolutionsmag.com/</ref> * ''[[Talent Development Magazine]]'' <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.td.org/Publications/Magazines/TD|title=TD Magazine|website=www.td.org|access-date=2016-04-12}}</ref> * ''[[Training Industry Magazine]]'' <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.trainingindustry.com/ezine.aspx|title=Training Industry Magazine {{!}} Training Industry|website=www.trainingindustry.com|access-date=2016-04-12}}</ref> (formerly ''Training & Development Magazine'') * ''[[Training Magazine]]'' <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://trainingmag.com/|title=Training Magazine|website=Training Magazine|access-date=2016-04-12}}</ref>

'''Contract city''' is a term used in some [[U.S. state]]s for a city that contracts one or more municipal services to another unit of government, or to a private or commercial organization. Most of the contracts are for police or fire / rescue / paramedic services to the county in which the city lies.
In the traditional method, ''franchising'', a private company has a [[government-granted monopoly|franchise]], or legal right, to perform certain public services normally done by municipal government. Cities of all kinds have entered into contracts for non-core governmental services, such as facilities and grounds maintenance, auditing, legal counsel, road construction, garbage collection, water and waste water treatment, engineering services, animal control, and others. Such cities rely on the private sector to provide public service delivery, while the public sector maintains oversight. Public officials are specifically responsible for writing, signing, managing and enforcing contracts.
Another method of contracting is for the city to contract with its county government or with neighboring cities to provide municipal services such as police and public safety, libraries, or parks and recreation.
In contrast, independent cities are cities which provide basic governmental services themselves, without contracting (this usage is not to be confused with the more common usage of [[independent city]] as a city that is not part of any [[County (United States)|county]]). Most older cities are independent cities. In practice, many cities are hybrids of both. For instance, they may directly operate parks programs, but contract with the county for police and fire services. Most contract cities do their own [[land use planning]], since cities were incorporated to exert local control over land use.
==History== In 1954, [[Lakewood, California]], became the first city to contract with its county for public services. The previously [[unincorporated area]] was facing a hostile annexation from adjacent [[Long Beach, California]], and residents favored retaining local control while maintaining the existing services provided by [[Los Angeles County, California|Los Angeles County]]. The so-called Lakewood Plan has been the model for most new contract cities incorporated since then.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lasdhq.org/lasd_services/contract_law/index.html |title=Welcome to contract law enforcement |work=Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department |accessdate=28 December 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130304185244/http://www.lasdhq.org/lasd_services/contract_law/index.html |archivedate=4 March 2013 |df= }}</ref>
In recent years there has been a significant increase in the number of contract cities. Several that have received attention from the media include: * [[Sandy Springs, Georgia]]<ref>http://reason.org/news/show/public-private-partnerships-fo-1</ref> * [[Centennial, Colorado]]<ref>http://reason.org/blog/show/centennial-colorado-incorporated-an</ref> * [[Maywood, California]]<ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2010/07/20/business/20maywood.html</ref> * [[Dunwoody, Georgia]]<ref>http://reason.org/news/show/reason-foundations-23rd-annual</ref>
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060814151809/http://www.contractcities.org/index.cfm?Page=History Contract City history] *[http://www.contractcities.org California Contract Cities Association] *[http://www.icacities.org/ Independent Cities Association] *[http://reason.org/areas/topic/local-government Reason Foundation, Local Government]

{{Underlinked|date=November 2016}} The term '''course of performance''' is defined in the [[Uniform Commercial Code]] as follows:
(a) A "course of performance" is a sequence of conduct between the parties to a particular transaction that exists if: :(1) the agreement of the parties with respect to the transaction involves repeated occasions for performance by a party; and :(2) the other party, with knowledge of the nature of the performance and opportunity for objection to it, accepts the performance or acquiesces in it without objection.
[https://www.law.cornell.edu/ucc/1/1-303 UCC § 1-303(a)]. "[[Course of dealing]]," as defined in [UCC § 1-303] subsection (b), is restricted, literally, to a sequence of conduct between the parties previous to the agreement. A sequence of conduct after or under the agreement, however, is a "course of performance."Cmt. 2, UCC § 1-303. Where a contract involves repeated occasions for performance and opportunity for objection "any course of performance accepted or acquiesced in without objection shall be relevant to determine the meaning of the agreement."UCC 2-208[1]. "[S]uch course of performance shall be relevant to show a waiver or modification of any term inconsistent with such course of performance."UCC 2-208[3]. This UCC section recognizes that the "parties themselves know best what they have meant by their words of agreement and their action under that agreement is the best indication of what that meaning was."UCC 2-208, cmt, 1. It is well established that a written contract may be modified by the parties' post-agreement "course of performance." See, e.g., ''Rose v. Spa Realty Assocs.'', 42 N.Y.2d 338, 397 N.Y.S.2d 922, 366 N.E.2d 1279 (1977); ''GE Capital Commer. Auto. Fin. v. Spartan Motors, Ltd.'', 246 A.D.2d 41, 52, 675 N.Y.S.2d 626, 634 (App. Div. 1998). A waiver that changes the express terms of a contract can be established by evidence of a course of performance. This holds true even for contracts that are fully integrated. The policy behind this "broad doctrine of waiver" in contract law is to "prevent the waiving party from 'lull[ing] another into a false assurance that strict compliance with a contractual duty will not be required and then sue for noncompliance.' "''Midwest Builder Distrib. v. Lord & Essex'', 383 Ill. App. 3d 645, 674, 322 Ill. Dec. 371, 398, 891 N.E.2d 1, 28 (2007); ''Whalen v. K Mart Corp.'', 166 Ill. App. 3d 339, 343, 519 N.E.2d 991, 116 Ill. Dec. 776 (1988). It is not necessary that the contract be ambiguous before course of performance will be considered.''Feinberg v. Federated Dept. Stores, Inc.'', 15 Misc. 3d 299, 300, 832 N.Y.S.2d 760, 761 (Sup. Ct. 2007). A course of dealing is shown by repeated instances of the relevant conduct, not single occasions or actions.''Dallas. Aero., Inc. v. CIS Air Corp.'', 352 F.3d 775, 783 (2d Cir. 2003); ''Cravotta v. Deggingers' Foundry, Inc.'', 288 P.3d 871 (Kan. Ct. App. 2012); ''Estate of Polushkin v. Maw'', 170 P.3d 162, 171 (Alaska 2007). ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Business law]] [[Category:Legal terminology]] [[Category:Uniform Commercial Code]]

{{unreferenced|date=January 2017}} {{Finance sidebar}} A '''[[Credit (finance)|credit]] note''' or '''credit memorandum (memo)''' is a commercial document issued by a [[seller]] to a [[buyer]]. Credit notes act as a [[Source document]] for the Sales return journal. In other words the credit note is evidence of the reduction in sales.
It can also be a document from a [[bank]] to a [[depositor]] to indicate the depositor's balance is being in event other than a deposit, such as the collection by the bank of the depositor's note receivable.
== Features ==
A credit note lists the products, quantities and agreed prices for products or services the seller provided the buyer, but the buyer returned or did not receive. It may be issued in the case of damaged goods, errors or allowances. In respect of the previously issued invoice, a Credit Memo will reduce or eliminate the amount the buyer has to pay. ''Note:'' A Credit Memo is not to be substituted as a formal document. The Credit Memo rarely contains: PO #, Date, Billing Address, Shipping Address, Terms of Payment, List of products with quantities and prices. Usually it references the original Invoice and sometimes states the reason for issue.
This is received if the goods are incomplete, damaged, or not as per specification; customers may also receive one if they paid too much money, or if they had been overcharged.
== Uses ==
* To allow the buyer to purchase an item or service from that seller on a future date, i.e. a [[gift card]] or store card credit. Credit notes may be issued by a seller as a goodwill gesture to a buyer who wishes to return previously purchased merchandise (instead of cash repayment) in circumstances where the original sales agreement did not include an explicit refund policy for returned items. In such circumstances, a credit note of value equal to the price of the returned item is usually issued allowing the buyer to exchange his purchase for other items available with the sale.
